bbd

Interface IBBDBeanBroker<B,L extends BBDBeanArrayList<B>>

  • Type Parameters:
    B - Any java bean POJO
    L - List of POJO of type
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBBDBroker<R,L>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BBDDefaultBroker

    public interface IBBDBeanBroker<B,L extends BBDBeanArrayList<B>>
extends java.io.Serializable
    Brokers provide methods for basic Create, Update, Delete (CRUD) functions. Extended classes operate on groups of stored procedures, such as: testInsert testUpdate testDelete These stored procedures may be operating on one table or various tables internal to the stored procedure. But the broker and the stored procedrues represent a logical grouping in the applications business data model.

      • select

        L select(B row)
  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Select information from database.
        Parameters:
        row - An BBDRow that contains the parameters used by the select method.
        Generally, parameters are used in the where clause of an select SQL statement to decrease the number of rows selected.
        Returns:
        An array list containting the rows resulting from the select.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • insertGetGeneratedKeys

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> insertGetGeneratedKeys(B row)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Insert information into database
        Parameters:
        row - list of fields required to insert into database.
        Returns:
        First item in list is rows inserted. second item in list is the auto generated key. -1 indicates error.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setPrincipal

        void setPrincipal(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String password)
        The broker creates connections to the database using a specified user name and password. User/pw may be hard coded in the broker, or set each time a broker is created or used.
        Parameters:
        name - name used for database connection
        password - password used for database oonnection

      • setPrincipal

        void setPrincipal(IBBDAPIPrincipal principal)
        The broker creates connections to the database using a specified user name and password. User/pw may be hard coded in the broker, or set each time a broker is created or used.
        Parameters:
        principal - database logon credential
